note: Interviewed 6 May 1993. G abal, Ivan: at the founding meeting o f O F (Civic Forum), later campaign manager for Civic Movement, previously member of the Circle of Independent Intellegentsia. Presently director of a market research company. Interviewed 15 April 1993.
title: Ivan: advisor to OF (Civic Forum), one of its four organization! leaders until the first elec­ tions, previously taught managers at the Research Institute of Technology and Economy, presently working for the Central Trade Unions
Slovak dissident, became chair of VPN, presently professor of sociology at the Charles University
Czechslovak Minister for Metallurgy and Heavy Industry, 1979-81; Vice Prime Minister, 1981-88; and Minister for Metallurgy
Presently a private businessman
Jiri: activist in the Socialist Party; was candidate to become the Party’s leader at the time of the interview
Michal: journalist, co-founder of the group M O ST (English: “ Bridge” ) which established the first contacts between the Communist Regime and Czech dissidents. Presently working for a betting agency
Zdenek: former editor of the Communist Party daily, Rude Pravo with obersver status in the Politburo, presently writing for the pro-Communist weekly Nase pravo

note: Jak es, M ilos: former General Secretary of the Com m unist Party (1 9 8 7 -8 9 ), presently retired. Interviewed 9
title: Jozef: dissident historian living in Bratislava, presently doing research at the Slovak Academy of Sciences

note: K ocab, Michal: well known Czech musician, co-founder of MOST, presently owner of a radio station and other businesses. Interviewed 4
title: Vlasta: member o f the strike committee at the Philosophical Faculty of the Charles University, was active in the campaign for Obcanske hnuti at the time of the interview on 5
Oskar: former advisor to Prime Ministers Adamec and Calfa

Magalena: member of the Strike Committee of the Educational and Sport Faculty of the Charles University and o f the Coordinating Committee o f O F (Civic Forum). Presently runs a news service for members of parliament
Former assistant to Planning Minister Potac
Miroslav: former member of the Politburo (1988-89) and secretary of the Prague Party; the only (x>mmunist leader to have served a prison sentence after the “ velvet revolution
